chargeHist.descr: Arson of Property Other Than Building
Arson of Property Other Than Building

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kalin E. Jones 642068 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Arson of Property Other Than Building [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.03.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Arson of Property Other Than Building [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.03.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Complete GED & HSED
Complete employment assessment and participate in appropriate job training to gain employment.

No contact with victims or their families.
No contact with co-defendants.
Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol. If given prescription medications only take as prescribed.

Complete psychosexual evaluation.
Complete Sex Offender treatment recommendations.
Complete Intervention program.
Complete Anger Management program.
Compelte further mental health evaluations deemed necessary by agent.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

records.addlTxt:
Case Called: 8:58 am
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry via Zoom Video. Defendant appears in custody via Zoom Video, pro se. Defendant's Father appears via Zoom Video.
State notes that Victim Rights are not complied with for this hearing, as there was no proper notification.
Court addresses the parties; Court notes that there was a scheduling conference on the record and notes that there would have been enough notice of today's hearing.
Parties are to proceed with today's hearing.
Court recites history of the case, makes statements. 
COURT Finds 353 Days Credit on Count 2; JOC to be Amended to Reflect 353 Days Credit. 
Adjourned: 9:11 am
Letters from DAI staff to Court requesting review of sentence credit

Letter to Court Regarding Jail Credit on Ct.2
03/24/2021: Approved to Amend JOC to reflect 435 days credit on Ct.2

Case Called: 10:36 am
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry via Zoom Video. Defendant appears in custody via Zoom Video, pro se. Defendant's Father C.Z. appears via Zoom Video.
VRCW.
Date and time set for a Sentence Adjustment Hearing- Request filed by the Defendant.
Court is not going to consider what was filed in December; Court to consider the Request filed in January. 
Defendant makes statements.
Defendant's Father C.Z. makes statement. 
State objects to any sentence adjustment and makes arguments. 
Court addresses the Defendant. 
COURT Denies Request for Sentence Adjustment. 

Defendant states that he has not gotten credit for Count 2; 
Court and the State discuss the sentence on Count 2; State notes that probation was never revoked on Count and Defendant was not sentenced to prison on Count 2.
ADA McGarry to provide a letter to the Court regarding the State's position on issue- 
Defendant makes statement. 
Court to address issue based on the State's letter and outcome- may or may not need to schedule a future hearing. 

Adjourned: 11:03 am

Case Called: 1:02 pm
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry via Zoom Video. 
VRCW. 
Parties need to schedule a hearing to address Sentence Adjustment. Defendant has filed a Petition for Sentence Adjustment.
DATES:
Sentence Adjustment Hearing 03/17/2021 @ 10:30 am

Adjourned: 1:03 pm
Calendar call on February 1, 2021 at 01:00 pm.
District Attorney Response on Petition for Sentence Adjustment

State appears by ADA K.Mayo.  Def appears by video from MCJ and by Atty Toulouse by video.
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW
*All appearances by zoom*

State notes agreement reached - Agreement by Atty Toulouse

COURT ORDERS: 
14CF1033 - Ct. 1>> 3.5 years TOTAL: 1.5 years incarceration and 2 years ES
15CF364 - Ct. 1>> 3.5 years TOTAL: 1.5 years incarceration and 2 years ES
15CF364 - Ct. 3 >> 4 years TOTAL - 2 years incarceration and 2 years ES (clerical error corrected to Ct. 3 on 8/18/20-clc)
15CF364 - Ct. 5>> 3.5 years TOTAL: 1.5 years incarceration and 2 years ES
15CF364 - Ct. 6>> 4 years TOTAL: 2  years incarceration and 2 years ES
15CF364 - Ct. 7>> 4 years TOTAL: 2 years incarceration and 2 years ES
ALL sentences to run CONCURRENT to each other and to any other sentence defendant is now serving.
CREDIT: 
14CF1033>>463 days
15CF364 - 435 days on each count
CONDITIONS of ES>> Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; AODA and follow up if not already completed; Absolute sobriety; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof; No contact with any victims in 15CF364 or their property; Unpaid restitution in 15CF364; All other costs that remain unpaid including any CC and DNA surcharge.
>>Defendant IS eligible for both CIP and SAP.
>>COURT ORDERS defendant remanded to MCSD for delivery to the WI State Prison System.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 3:06pm
INCLUDES 14CF1033, 14CF1063, and 15CF364
State appears by ADA Ralph Uttke; Defendant appears in person, in custody, with Atty John Wallace
Date and time set for sentencing hearing

State is ready to proceed with sentencing today
Atty Wallace states deft is in agreement with PSI report and psychological evaluation
State makes argument on sentencing
Atty Wallace makes argument on sentencing
COURT makes findings
COURT ORDERS: In 14CF1033: Ct. 1 Manufacture/Deliver THC - w/hold sentencing. 5 years probation. CONDITION: Serve 1 year jail, credit granted of 350 days of time already served. In 14CF1063 Ct. 1 4th degee sexual assault - w/hold sentencing. 2 years probation, concurrent. In 15CF364: Ct. 2 Bail jumping- felony- I/S 4 years WSPS: 2 years IC, 2 years ES. On Ct. 1 Arson of property other than building- As condition of probation, serve 1 year jail beginning today consecutive to one year jail in 14CF1033 Ct. 1. Jail can be with huber for work, work search, and treatment if meets jail criteria. In 15CF364 on Ct. 1, Ct. 3 - Bail Jumping- Felony, Ct. 5- Arson of property other than building, PTAC, Ct. 6- Bail Jumping- Felony, and Ct. 7- Bail Jumping- Felony: w/hold sentencing on all five counts. 5 years probation, concurrent to 14CF1033 & 14CF1063.
CONDITONS of all three files: Complete psychosexual evaluation. Complete sex offender treatment recommendations. Complete cognitive intervention program. Complete Anger Management program. Pay back restitution to victim- W.G. of $5,048.00 and $4,230.00 to victims- W.R. & L.D. joint and several liability with co-defendants. No contact with co-defendants. No contact with victims or victims families. Complete GED or HSED. Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, if given prescribed medications, only take as prescribed. Complete employment assessment and participate in appropriate job training to gain employment. Complete AODA assessment with follow through. Complete any further mental health evaluations deemed necessary by agent. Pay CC. Pay DNA sample and surcharge. 

State and Atty Wallace to maintain PSI in confidental manner.

Adj: 4:26pm
Sentencing hearing on April 4, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 9:38am
INCLUDES 14CF1033, 14CF1063, 15CF31, & 15CF364
State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer.  Deft appears in person, in custody, with Atty John Wallace
 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
14CF1033

14CF1063

15CF364

Ct. 5 Arson of Property Other than Building, PTAC >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty.
